VSCode http://michaelacheong.com/vscode/ Thu, 26 May 2022 09:26:13 +1000
http://michaelacheong.com/vscode/ I think you call this a stack, where you talk about applications you use and their setup. So, I am gonna write a university stack, or a general productivity stack, but this is my VSCode stack, which in essence is a list of extensions I use and my setup. Colour Theme: Rouge I like navy and the soft pink is really nice. -I also have used Horizon Bright by jolaleye if I ever want to use a light theme (so, not super often, but enough to say I like it as a theme).

CSS http://michaelacheong.com/css/ Mon, 23 May 2022 21:54:05 +1000
http://michaelacheong.com/css/ I only slightly want to claw my eyes out. May I please just have pretty fonts? https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Web_fonts https://discourse.gohugo.io/t/how-to-load-assets-from-the-static-folder-in-a-css-file/21005 Need to fix theme-vars.css with my actual desired fonts lol
GitHub http://michaelacheong.com/github/ Mon, 23 May 2022 15:34:05 +1000
http://michaelacheong.com/github/ I am an absolute GitHub noob, but like, I’m trying my best. When I created this website, I didn’t realise I should have created the hugo new site in a cloned repository that was already on my computer, so, I am using the second answer of this stack overflow question to do it. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3311774/how-to-convert-existing-non-empty-directory-into-a-git-working-directory-and-pus After some finicking, I now have my Hugo site version control being managed in Git. I think.
Hugo http://michaelacheong.com/hugo/ Mon, 23 May 2022 15:04:53 +1000
http://michaelacheong.com/hugo/ <<<<<<< HEAD What I use to make my site. ======= <<<<<<< HEAD What I use to make my site. ======= I already have broken my website. I started with hugo new post/so-it-began.md to create my first post, and then tried to change the folder “post” to “posts”, added a second file with hugo new posts/digital-garden.md, and now it’s not showing up on my website. lol. Thanks to this video for the setup guide tho https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LIFvgrRxdt4 I am a bit unnerved by the fact that he doesn’t merge to the main branch via a pull request and instead commits straight to the main branch. >>>>>>> main >>>>>>> d689277ea1d689aa3d91fcf6d467265e02888bd7
